Reviews.Content: shabby We broke our flight to Sydney with an overnight stay, both ways, at the Hotel Royal. On the way out, it was OK. Not smart, a bit shabby, but all we wanted was a bed for us, a bed for our 3yr old and a cot for our 1yr old. The cot was broken so we asked for another one and they replaced it straight away. Friendly people. On our return, two weeks later, things didn't go well. The room was not ready when we arrived at 3.30pm and we had to wait over half an hour with exhausted children. They gave us a complimentary drink in the restaurant, but we quickly found that only coffee or synthetic yuk drinks. Certainly no fresh fruit juice. The room was was OK. The bathroom wasn't particularly clean (dusty, someone else's hair on the hair-dryer base) and the same broken cot in the room, so we complained. We survived, but we won't go back.
Reviews.Author: Zing1

Reviews.Content: Standard hotel in reasonable location Booked through Singapore Airlines Stopover holiday, this hotel is conveniently located for Orchard Rd shopping. Standard large hotel.
Reviews.Author: Kevinandhelena

Reviews.Content: Loved the location We stayed there for 3 nights. Very convenient location, close to the metro. Decoration of rooms a bit out of date but confortable. The breakfast is very interesting: a lot of hosts from different countries show the different approach of breakfast !On the evening convenient and good food for the price.
Reviews.Author: BERNY85

Reviews.Content: CHEAP HOTEL- better options available I had one night in Singers before heading onwards to Vietnam. I didn't want anything fancy and I didn't get anything fancy. I reckon I paid about $90 for this hotel. When I got there, they gave me a smoking room but it smelt quite bad so had to get this changed. I am an agent so I know I requested Non smoking. They moved me quite happily and I got upgraded to a suite of some description- the room was huge- had 2 single beds- but was just me so no drama. There are no bells and whistles with this hotel. The breakfast is basic yet functional. It's a bed for the night. If you are looking at staying longer in Singapore then try the Peninsular Excelsior- not far from Raffles and is a good value 3*. Not too far from a metro station ( 10 minutes walk??) so accessible to transport. Not my favourite place to stay but hey I didn't pay much for it. You get what you pay for here.
Reviews.Author: wildflowerb

Reviews.Content: Wouldn't stay there again We booked here for two nights, and the room had 1970 furnishings, nothing in the rooms about the hotel or what to do in Singapore, the clerks at the front office, was rather rude and not helpful in any way. We had our two year old with us and so three people in the room and only gave us two towels. Breakfast was powered egg and broiled ham, so not my idea of a good full buffet breakfast. The bath didn't hold any water because the plug was broken, cockroaches if you turned on the light at night and scared them, annoying elevator music played continually all throughout the night and you could hear people coming and going rather easily. It was close to two shopping centres and it was easy to get cabs, but would definately not stay there again.
Reviews.Author: kristyjs

Reviews.Content: Great if you like a brothel on the premises Lovely frontage however next to reception is a working nightly brothel come bar where woman travelling on their own are not encouraged to use. The ladies take their men past the swimming pool to the car parks to do their business. If you have children do not stay here. No suitable bar in this place however I was told to walk a block down the road as their was a nice english bar where I could get a drink rather than going into the ladies of the night bar adjacent the main reception. I was astonished. Rooms are very dirty however beware looks are very deceiving, pay a tad extra and you will enjoy your place of stay in lovely Singapore. Dale - New Zealand
Reviews.Author: KiwiDale

Reviews.Content: Intolerable I go to Singapore 5-10 times a year, and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in Singapore in 20 years. I booked this room on HotelClub which I have used with great success in the past throughout Asia. In this case it was a terrible mistake. The room smelled horrible, was dirty and stained. Furthermore, and most important, the air conditioning had two settings - on or off. On was way too cold and off was (as expected in a tropical climate) unacceptably hot. The hotel solution was an offer to give me more blankets. I checked out before staying one night and stayed at Traders Hotel at double the price. When I checked out of Hotel Royal, the clerk told me they would bill me for one night. I called Hotelclub and also went online to cancel the reservation. This was to no avail as I later discovered that Hotel Royal invoiced Hotelclub for the full stay. I am still negotiating with Hotelclub, filed a complaint with Hotel Royal and will file a complaint with the Singapore Tourist Board. Mark (Bangkok)
Reviews.Author: Toponoetikos

Reviews.Content: Smilly dirty room I stayed for 10 days in sept 2007, they gave us very dirty room, smelly and the bedsheets are stained. When I asked to change the room they requested me to wait till evening, they shifted me to another room which is little better than the older room but still to dirty............I think the hotel is good from outside only but the rooms are so bad I don't recommend this hotel to anybody unless you want smelly room.
Reviews.Author: DrHusain

Reviews.Content: good located, but shabby and not clean The hotel is conveniently located (5 min walking from metro station of Novena), but it seemed to be shabby. The room had the carpet stained and was not as clean as expected. TV in the room was not working at all. Breakfast quite essential. In some web sites is quoted as 4 stars: ridiculous...For few dollars more you can get much better in Singapore.
Reviews.Author: FabioC

Reviews.Content: Value for money Read previous reviews but had already booked so hoped for the best and pleasantly surprised. We were only there one night, didn't notice any smoke smells in the room. Breakfast was a good feed.Access to MRT station was convenient so quite happy to stay there again.Malcolm
Reviews.Author: Applewoodnz

Reviews.Content: Okay when part of SIA package We stayed here for 3 nights as part of the Singapore Airlines package. The room was nice and spacious, we had only booked a double with a baby cot for our daughter, but they gave us a family room with a queen and single bed. So that was a nice surprise.Our room was right next door to the elevator but we didn't hear anything at night time to annoy us. Not much noise in general either as others have commented on.They were very welcoming regarding a late checkout, we stayed in the room till at least 3pm, then stored our luggage, and we then had a swim and shower before leaving at 8.30pm.Novena MRT station is very close as are 2 reasonable sized shopping malls.
Reviews.Author: ceresNewZealand

Reviews.Content: location to the great orchard road       enjoy singapore
Reviews.Author: teddy28

Reviews.Content: Old hotel but good location I must agree with welovetotravel01's review. Booked through SIA program and was disappointed to find a smelly room (I regretted that I didn't specifically asked for a non smoking room), worn carpet and noisy cleaning staffs in the morning. The bathroom is OK but no slippers available. The location is OK in a quiet area but near a mall and an MRT. The staffs are helpful but they couldn't help us finding a non smoking room (only 1 non smoking floor ). I would not return to this hotel.
Reviews.Author: passionfortravel2

Reviews.Content: traveller beware!       bring your ear plugs!
Reviews.Author: welovetotravel01

Reviews.Content: Great value! Seeing the poor reviews I feel an update is required.We booked a twin room through Singapore Airlines for US$244 for 3 nights, incld. b'fast and airport transfers.Room: standard with all the expected amenities. Bathroom: clean and normal size. Water pressure good.B'fast very good, great variety: Western, Malay, Indian, Chinese and even a small selection of Yam Cha ( Dim Sum).Staff friendly enough (for S'pore). Tour desk guy terrific!Transport A1!! Bus at door step. 2 bus stops to Newton MRT. Very useful at night when all taxis seem to be on hire.Internet cafe 2 mins. walk away. Newton Circus hawker stalls 10 mins. walk or 2 bus stops.Never tried the pool, too busy.All in all a pleasant surprise to us after reading the lousy reviews.I'd recommed this hotel to anyone who does not crave 5 * digs.
Reviews.Author: Tikus

Reviews.Content: Just Adequate I would say that this is a typical budget tourist hotel where you one gets an adequate room with just adequate service. The turnover of tour groups that comes through this hotel must be quite large as it seemed to me that the hotel lobby was always filled with tour groups and their luggage either coming or going. In the evenings, the small lobby's ambience was not helped at all by its Karaoke Bar which had photos of female hostesses posted at the Bar's entrance. The hotel restaurant was again, just adequate in terms of space, service and overall food quality. The one thing going for the hotel is that it is located just a few minutes from a subway stop so that it was easy to get around if the hotel itself is not centrally located. There are also small shopping areas within walking distance. The hotel happened to have been booked for us and was thus not our choice. While we did not have a bad stay, I am quite certain we would choose a different hotel the next time we go to Singapore. However, for budget travelers who just want something adequate, the hotel would do just fine.
Reviews.Author: Domrcpl

Reviews.Content: OK for the price Generally an inexpensive 3 star hotel which is reasonably well located.You need to walk for about 8 min to the Novena MRT station which can get you to town easily.Good Points:CheapRooms are good sized for the price you are payingThey even provide combs, toothbrush and toothpaste. Not bad for a hotel like thisQuite cleanThe have a poolService is satisfactoryBad points:Shopping centre not at your doorstep.The elevators are hopeless and requires better maintenanceOvercrowded with group tourists Breakfast is fairly basic and you have to fight with the crowds!Obviously an old hotel but efforts has been made to make it look newOVERALL:Don't expect 5 star facilities and service. You are only paying 2.5 star price for a 3 star hotel. So, I am reasonably satisfied
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne

Reviews.Content: Dirty and Worn Checked in and found the room dirty and the bathroom even worse. The tub had hair still in it from the previous guest. Thought maybe after we stayed one night and the room was cleaned the next day it would be up to standards. It wasn't. Only stayed two nights then had to leave. Will not stay there again or recommend it to anyone. Very poor house keeping.
Reviews.Author: Salty57
